TopicTitle: Open Source Construction Techniques for Craft Aesthetics

Articles.Content:
Since the redesigned structural fuselages are now hollow, we can use them as crew tunnels and since the new Mk.1 crew cabins have doors that exit out of their ends, these can be used in the following manner:

Since the redesigned structural fuselages are now hollow, we can use them as crew tunnels and since the new Mk.1 crew cabins have doors that exit out of their ends, these can be used in the following manner:

http://imgur.com/a/UC8TF

Oh god yes, YES! Thank you!

Since the redesigned structural fuselages are now hollow, we can use them as crew tunnels and since the new Mk.1 crew cabins have doors that exit out of their ends, these can be used in the following manner:

http://imgur.com/a/UC8TF

Yup, I tried this yesterday, I can confirm it works great.

Since the redesigned structural fuselages are now hollow, we can use them as crew tunnels and since the new Mk.1 crew cabins have doors that exit out of their ends

How many kerbals can one stuff inside one of these high density crew modules structural fuselages?
An estimate would be at least four or five. The tubes are very light. So are command seats...
extending on the above mk1 cockpit
Amazing.

extending on the above mk1 cockpit

http://i.imgur.com/OvITSF1.png

http://i.imgur.com/9Tac7AA.png

What am I missing here? I don't see the point.

i guess he used the new MK1 cockpit to create 'access' doors / airlocks on anything

at least, with that we can easily place access doors almost anywhere we want to (and it fits in a 1.25m tube - unlike the lander pod which is larger than 1.25m )

i guess he used the new MK1 cockpit to create 'access' doors / airlocks on anything

at least, with that we can easily place access doors almost anywhere we want to (and it fits in a 1.25m tube - unlike the lander pod which is larger than 1.25m )

Sure that part is clear.

However, I still don't see the point. You cant really use the pod. And as you can only exit on one side it makes no sense.

Edited November 14, 2015 by Majorjim

Sure that part is clear. However, I still don't see the point. You cant really use the pod. And as you can only exit on one side it makes no sense.

It can be used as an access point like in a hab or as a funky airlock in a big ship. I use something similar in The Dunatian as an airlock entrance to the hab, but as sgt_flyer said with a lander can, this is a bit smoother, and I was forced to 2.5m because of the shape of the can.

It can be used as an access point like in a hab or as a funky airlock in a big ship. I use something similar in The Dunatian as an airlock entrance to the hab, but as sgt_flyer said with a lander can, this is a bit smoother, and I was forced to 2.5m because of the shape of the can.

I see the thinking behind it but when you exit the pod you will clip through the tube. So you will have that pod extending into the hab? Or will you have to swap to another pod inside anyway? I really don't see how this would work.

I see the thinking behind it but when you exit the pod you will clip through the tube. So you will have that pod extending into the hab? Or will you have to swap to another pod inside anyway? I really don't see how this would work.

It's like you have never seen my stuff

Yes you can switch to a pod inside and then EVA inside the fairing, which can have a full interior built inside.

It's like you have never seen my stuff

http://i.imgur.com/O7AMMu5.png

Yes you can switch to a pod inside and then EVA inside the fairing, which can have a full interior built inside.

Yeees Iv'e seen ya stuff man. Ok, so as it worked before just with a little tunnel leading up to the pod door. Then you swap to a pod that has an inside access door?
The new Mk0 intake is great for portholes.

Yeees Iv'e seen ya stuff man. Ok, so as it worked before just with a little tunnel leading up to the pod door. Then you swap to a pod that has an inside access door?

Not really, it would be like the airlock entry to the hab, just cleaner and smaller

Not really, it would be like the airlock entry to the hab, just cleaner and smaller

That's what you do now though right? Enter door that is exposed outside the hab then swap to a pod that has a door inside the fairing.

That's what you do now though right? Enter door that is exposed outside the hab then swap to a pod that has a door inside the fairing.

Yep, this would just be a nicer looking and smaller door

Yep, this would just be a nicer looking and smaller door

I would imagine the new 2 kerbal crew module being even better as it has access points in both ends. If you use your trick above with one of those, but stick one end inside the fairing and the other end outside, you don't even need the crew transfer to get a kerbal inside. Just enter through the outside door, and EVA through the inside one.

I would imagine the new 2 kerbal crew module being even better as it has access points in both ends. If you use your trick above with one of those, but stick one end inside the fairing and the other end outside, you don't even need the crew transfer to get a kerbal inside. Just enter through the outside door, and EVA through the inside one.

Very true

Sure that part is clear.

However, I still don't see the point. You cant really use the pod. And as you can only exit on one side it makes no sense.

Does making Jeb jump out of his ship and fall into Jool have point? Or course not! THIS IS KERBAL SPACE PROGRAM, FOR GODS SAKE

Howdy folks, thought I'd share a wing design that's been eluding me for a while now. Chances are someone's cracked this already, but if not hope this helps. Basically it's an emulation of the Sukhoi wing (SU-27) made up of a swept wing type A, type B and a couple of flipped wing strakes. The nice thing about this is you can add rails to the outside to put fancy weapons on.

[imgur]Unbvj[/imgur]

[quote name='Zucal']The new Mk0 intake is great for portholes.[/QUOTE]

My little trick is practically the same (you beat me to it), but with some very fine offset to produce a slightly different effect. It can even be used as a mock cockpit of sorts for tiny craft.

[imgur]qmZdB[/imgur]
